cleanSlate.name: New Jersey Clean Slate Law
cleanSlate.description: New Jersey's Clean Slate law provides automatic expungement of certain criminal records for individuals who have been crime-free for 10 years. This is in addition to the traditional petition-based expungement process.

automaticExpungement.condition: No new convictions during the 10-year period
automaticExpungement.processTime: Automatic processing by State Police and courts

cleanSlate.note: Clean Slate automatic expungement applies to records in the State Police central repository

cleanSlateHighlights: New Jersey Clean Slate law enacted in 2019, effective June 2020
Provides automatic expungement for crime-free individuals after 10 years
Covers both indictable (felony) and disorderly persons (misdemeanor) offenses
Completely FREE - no petition or filing required
First state in the nation to combine Clean Slate with early pathway options
Estimated to affect over 2 million New Jersey residents
